t: Luke 20
And*p it came to pass, that on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders,
And*p spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?
And*p he answered and said unto them, I*r will*r also*r ask*r you*r one*r thing;*r and*r answer*r me:*r
The*rp baptism*r of*r John,*r was*r it*r from*r heaven,*r or*r of*r men?*r
And*p they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?
But*p and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.
And*p they answered, that they could not tell whence it was.
And*p Jesus said unto them, Neither*r tell*r I*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.*r

Then*p began he to speak to the people this parable; A*r certain*r man*r planted*r a*r vineyard,*r and*r let*r it*r forth*r to*r husbandmen,*r and*r went*r into*r a*r far*r country*r for*r a*r long*r time.*r

And*rp at*r the*r season*r he*r sent*r a*r servant*r to*r the*r husbandmen,*r that*r they*r should*r give*r him*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vineyard:*r but*r the*r husbandmen*r beat*r him,*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r empty.*r
And*rp again*r he*r sent*r another*r servant:*r and*r they*r beat*r him*r also,*r and*r entreated*r him*r shamefully,*r and*r sent*r him*r away*r empty.*r
And*rp again*r he*r sent*r a*r third:*r and*r they*r wounded*r him*r also,*r and*r cast*r him*r out.*r
Then*rp said*r the*r lord*r of*r the*r vineyard,*r What*r shall*r I*r do?*r I*r will*r send*r my*r beloved*r son:*r it*r may*r be*r they*r will*r reverence*r him*r when*r they*r see*r him.*r

But*rp when*r the*r husbandmen*r saw*r him,*r they*r reasoned*r among*r themselves,*r saying,*r This*r is*r the*r heir:*r come,*r let*r us*r kill*r him,*r that*r the*r inheritance*r may*r be*r ours.*r
So*rp they*r cast*r him*r out*r of*r the*r vineyard,*r and*r killed*r him.*r What*r therefore*r shall*r the*r lord*r of*r the*r vineyard*r do*r unto*r them?*r
He*rp shall*r come*r and*r destroy*r these*r husbandmen,*r and*r shall*r give*r the*r vineyard*r to*r others.*r And when they heard it, they said, God forbid.
And*p he beheld them, and said, What*r is*r this*r then*r that*r is*r written,*r The*r stone*r which*r the*r builders*r rejected,*r the*r same*r is*r become*r the*r head*r of*r the*r corner?*r
Whosoever*rp shall*r fall*r upon*r that*r stone*r shall*r be*r broken;*r but*r on*r whomsoever*r it*r shall*r fall,*r it*r will*r grind*r him*r to*r powder.*r
And*p the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.

And*p they watched him, and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.
And*p they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person of any, but teachest the way of God truly:
Is*p it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or no?
But*p he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why*r tempt*r ye*r me?*r
Shew*rp me*r a*r penny.*r Whose*r image*r and*r superscription*r hath*r it?*r They answered and said, Caesar's.
And*p he said unto them, Render*r therefore*r unto*r Caesar*r the*r things*r which*r be*r Caesar's,*r and*r unto*r God*r the*r things*r which*r be*r God's.*r
And*p they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.
Then*p came to him certain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,
Saying,*p Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man's brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
There*p were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.
And*p the second took her to wife, and he died childless.
And*p the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.
Last*p of all the woman died also.
Therefore*p in the resurrection whose wife of them is she? for seven had her to wife.
And*p Jesus answering said unto them, The*r children*r of*r this*r world*r marry,*r and*r are*r given*r in*r marriage:*r
But*rp they*r which*r shall*r be*r accounted*r worthy*r to*r obtain*r that*r world,*r and*r the*r resurrection*r from*r the*r dead,*r neither*r marry,*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage:*r
Neither*rp can*r they*r die*r any*r more:*r for*r they*r are*r equal*r unto*r the*r angels;*r and*r are*r the*r children*r of*r God,*r being*r the*r children*r of*r the*r resurrection.*r

Now*rp that*r the*r dead*r are*r raised,*r even*r Moses*r shewed*r at*r the*r bush,*r when*r he*r calleth*r the*r Lord*r the*r God*r of*r Abraham,*r and*r the*r God*r of*r Isaac,*r and*r the*r God*r of*r Jacob.*r
For*rp he*r is*r not*r a*r God*r of*r the*r dead,*r but*r of*r the*r living:*r for*r all*r live*r unto*r him.*r
Then*p certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.
And*p after that they durst not ask him any question at all.
And*p he said unto them, How*r say*r they*r that*r Christ*r is*r David's*r son?*r
And*rp David*r himself*r saith*r in*r the*r book*r of*r Psalms,*r The*r Lord*r said*r unto*r my*r Lord,*r Sit*r thou*r on*r my*r right*r hand,*r
Till*rp I*r make*r thine*r enemies*r thy*r footstool.*r
David*rp therefore*r calleth*r him*r Lord,*r how*r is*r he*r then*r his*r son?*r
Then*p in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,

Beware*rp of*r the*r scribes,*r which*r desire*r to*r walk*r in*r long*r robes,*r and*r love*r greetings*r in*r the*r markets,*r and*r the*r highest*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues,*r and*r the*r chief*r rooms*r at*r feasts;*r
Which*rp devour*r widows'*r houses,*r and*r for*r a*r shew*r make*r long*r prayers:*r the*r same*r shall*r receive*r greater*r damnation.*r
